text: Answer: (c) and (d) Solution: (@) True - as a non-preemptive policy, response time is generally terrible. (b) True - round robin is good for responsiveness, but generally delays the end time of the processes; rather than focusing on one process and finishing it, we keep switching between them, and they all finish late. (0) False - we simply let processes work through our queues and no estimate of how long they run is ever needed or used. (d) False - it decides which ready process to run next.
